page.title: 03A YEAR IN TURNERS HILL
page.content: Each year Turners Hill celebrates {St.George's Day, April 23rd,}on the village green. In 1984,{Guides}acted a play about St George. Sarah Jane Brackpool was St George, the other Guides were the dragon. There were {morris dancers}outside The Crown. Everyone danced round the{maypole. Several times a year, there are{Jazz {Thrash}evenings behind The Red Lion to raise funds for the church. One Sunday each June Turners Hill is invaded by bicyclists on the{London to {Brighton Bike}ride. In 1985, about {20,000}went though the village, most of them stopped for a rest. Bikes everywhere, a sight to behold! The Police take over the village school as a control point. There are two{fetes in May, school{sportsday, flower show, {cricket}and{football, November 5th {bonfire}and{Christmas}celebrations.
